lines.gurmukhi: 1 DRU Bgq
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: DRU hsdw Gir AwieAw kir ipAwru ipau kuCiV lIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhr Hasadaa Ghari Aaiaa Kari Piaaru Piu Kouchharhi Leetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Boy Dhru came smiling to his house (palace) and his father full of love put him into his lap.

lines.gurmukhi: bwhhu pkiV auTwilAw mn ivic rosu mqRyeI kIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Baaharu Pakarhi Outdaaliaa Man Vichi Rosu Matrayee Keetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing this, the stepmother got angry and catching hold of his arm pushed him out of the lap of the father (the king).

lines.gurmukhi: fufhuilkw mwN puCY qUM swvwxI hY ik surIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Dudahulikaa Maan Pouchhai Toon Saavaanee Hai Ki Sureetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tearful with fear he asked his mother whether she was a queen or a maidservant?

lines.gurmukhi: swvwxI hwN jnm dI nwmu n BgqI krim diRVHIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Saavaanee Haan Janam Dee Naamu N Bhagatee Karami Drirhheetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: O son! (said she) I was born queen but I did not remember God and did not undertake acts of devotion (and this is the reason of yours and mine plight).

lines.gurmukhi: iksu audm qy rwju imlY sqRU qy sB hovin mIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Kisu Udam Tay Raaju Mili Satr Tay Sabhi Hovani Meetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With that effort can the kingdom be had (asked Dhru) and how can enemies turn friends?

lines.gurmukhi: prmysru AwrwDIAY ijdU hoeIAY piqq punIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Paramaysaru Aaraadheeai Jidoo Hoeeai Patit Pouneetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord should be worshipped and thus the sinners also become sacred ones (said the mother).

lines.gurmukhi: bwhir cilAw krix qpu mn bYrwgI hoie AqIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Baahari Chaliaa Karani Tapu Man Bairaagee Hoi Ateetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to this and getting totally detached in his mind Dhru went out (to the jungle) to undertake rigorous discipline.

lines.gurmukhi: nwrd muin aupdyisAw nwm inDwnu AimE rsu pIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Naarad Mouni Oupadaysiaa Naau Nidhaanu Amiao Rasu Peetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the way, sage Narad taught him the technique of devotion and Dhru quaffed the nectar from the ocean of the Name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: ipChuM rwjy sidAw Aibcl rwj krhu inq nIqw
lines.transliteration_english: Pichhahu Raajay Sadiaa Abichalu Raaju Karahu Nit Neetaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: (After some time) King (Uttanpad) called him back and asked him (Dhru) to rule forever.

lines.gurmukhi: hwir cly gurmuiK jgjIqw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Haari Chalay Guramoukhi Jag Jeetaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs who seem to be losing i.e. who turn their faces from the evil propensities, conquer the world.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 pHlwd Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Prahlad

lines.gurmukhi: Gir hrxwKs dYq dy klir kvlu Bgqu piHlwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Haranaakhas Dait Day Kalari Kavalu Bhagatu Prahilaadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Prahlad, the saint, was born in the house of demon (king) Haranakhas like a lotus is born in the alkaline (barren) land.

lines.gurmukhi: pVHn pTwieAw cwtswl pwNDY iciq hoAw Aihlwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Parhhan Patdaaiaa Chaatasaal Paandhay Chiti Hoaa Ahilaadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: When he was sent to seminary, the brahmin purohit became elated (because the king’s son was now his disciple).

lines.gurmukhi: ismrY mn ivic rwm nwm gwvY sbdu Anwhd nwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Simarai Man Vichi Raam Naam Gaavai Sabadu Anaahadu Naadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Prahlad would remember the name of Ram in his heart and outwardly also he would eulogise the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq krin sB cwtVY pwNDy hoey rhy ivsmwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Karani Sabh Chaatarhai Paandhay Hoi Rahay Visamaadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now all the disciples became devotees of Lord, which was an awful and embarrassing situation for all the teachers.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy pwis rUAwieAw doKI dYiq vDwieAw vwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Paasi Rooaaiaa Dokhee Daiti Vadhaaiaa Vaadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: The priest (teacher) reported or complained to the king (that O king your son has become devotee of God).

lines.gurmukhi: jl AgnI ivic GiqAw jlY n fubY gur prswid
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Aganee Vichi Ghatiaa Jalai N Doubai Gur Parasaadi.

Shabad OS B.translation: The malevolent demon picked up the quarrel. Prahlad was thrown into fire and water but with the grace of Guru (the Lord) neither he was burnt nor drowned.

lines.gurmukhi: kiF KVgu sid puiCAw kauxu su qyrw hY ausqwdu
lines.transliteration_english: Karhi Kharhagu Sadi Pouchhiaa Kaounu Su Tayraa Hai Ousataadu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Angered as he was, Hiranyaksyapu took out his double-edged sword and asked Prahlad who his Guru (Lord) was.

lines.gurmukhi: QMmHu pwiV prgitAw nrisMG rUp AnUp Anwid
lines.transliteration_english: Danmh Paarhi Paragatiaa Narasingh Roop Anoop Anaadi.

Shabad OS B.translation: At the same moment Lord God in the form of man-lion came out of pillar. His form was grand and majestic.

lines.gurmukhi: bymuK pkiV pCwiVAnu sMq shweI Awid jugwid
lines.transliteration_english: Baymakh Pakarhi Pachhaarhianu Sant Sahaaee Aadi Jougaadi.

Shabad OS B.translation: That wicked demon was thrown down and killed and thus it was proved that the Lord is kind to devotees since the time immemorial.

lines.gurmukhi: jY jY kwr krn bHmwid ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Jai Jai Kaar Karani Brahamaadi ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing this Brahma and other gods started eulogising the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 rwjw bil

Shabad OS B.translation: Bali, the king

lines.gurmukhi: bil rwjw Gir AwpxY AMdir bYTw jgu krwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bali Raajaa Ghari Aapanai Andari Baitdaa Jagi Karaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bali, the king, was busy in performing a yajna in his palace.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn rUpI AwieAw cwir vyd muiK pwT suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Roopee Aaiaa Chaari Vayd Moukhi Paatd Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A low stature dwarf in the form of brahmin came there reciting all the four Vedas.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy AMdir sidAw mMg suAwmI jo quDu BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Andari Sadiaa Mangu Suaamee Jo Tudhu Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The king after calling him in asked him to demand anything he liked.

lines.gurmukhi: AClu Clix quDu AwieAw sukR puroihqu kih smJwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Achhalu Chhalani Tudhu Aaiaa Soukr Purohitu Kahi Samajhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Immediately priest Sukracharya made the king (Bali) understand that he (the beggar) is undeceivable God and He had came to delude him.

lines.gurmukhi: krau AFweI Driq mMig ipChu dy qiHu loA n mwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karau Addhaaee Dharati Mangi Pichhahu Day Trihu Loa N Maavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dwarf demanded two and half steps length of earth (which was granted by the king).

lines.gurmukhi: duie krvwN kir iqMn loA bil rwjw lY mgru imxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Karavaan Kari Tinn Loa Bali Raajaa Lai Magaru Minaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then the dwarf expanded his body so much that now the three worlds were insufficient for him.

lines.gurmukhi: bil Cil Awpu ClwieAnu hoie dieAwlu imlY gil lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bali Chhali Aapu Chhalaaianu Hoi Daiaalu Milai Gali Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even knowing this deception Bali allowed himself to be deceived so, and seeing this Vishnu embraced him.

lines.gurmukhi: idqw rwju pqwl dw hoie ADInu Bgiq jsu gwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ditaa Raaju Pataal Daa Hoi Adheenu Bhagati Jasu Gaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When he covered the three worlds in two steps, for third half-step king Bali offered his own back.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie drvwn mhwN suKu pwvY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Daravaan Mahaan Soukhu Paavai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Bali was given the kingdom of the netherworld where surrendering to God he engaged himself in the loving devotion of the Lord. Vishnu was delighted to be the doorkeeper of Bali.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 AMbrIk BgqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Ambaris

lines.gurmukhi: AMbrIk muih vrqu hY rwiq peI durbwsw AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbareek Muhi Varatu Hai Raati Paee Durabaasaa Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One evening while king Ambaris was fasting he was visited by sage Durvasa

lines.gurmukhi: BIVw Esu aupwrxw Ehu auiT nHwvix ndI isDwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bheerhaa Aosu Oupaaranaa Aohu Outdi Nhaavani Nadee Sidhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The king was to break his fast while serving Durvasa but the rishi went to the riverbank to take a bath.

lines.gurmukhi: crxodku lY poiKAw Ehu srwpu dyvx no DwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodaku Lai Pokhiaa Aohu Saraapu Dayn No Dhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fearing the change of date (which would deem his fast fruitless), the king broke his fast by drinking the water which he had poured on the feet of the rishi. When the rishi realised that the king had not served him first, he ran to curse the king.

lines.gurmukhi: ckR sudrsnu kwl rUp hoie BIhwvlu grbu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chakr Sudarasanu Kaal Roop Hoi Bheehaavalu Garabu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On this, Vishnu ordered his death like disc to move towards Durvasa  and thus the ego of Durvasa was removed.

lines.gurmukhi: bwmHxu BMnw jIau lY riK n hMGin dyv sbwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baamhanu Bhannaa Jeeu Lai Rakhi N Hanghani Dayv Sabaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now Brahmin Durvasa ran for his life. Even the gods and deities could not afford him shelter.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdRR loku isv loku qij bHm loku bYkuMT qjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Indr Loku Siv Loku Taji Braham Loku Baikountd Tajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He was avoided in the abodes of Indra, Siva, Brahma and the heavens.

lines.gurmukhi: dyviqAwN Bgvwn sxu isiK dyie sBnwN smJwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvatiaan Bhagavaanu Sanu Sikhi Dayi Sabhanaan Samajhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gods and God made him understand (that none except Ambaris could save him).

lines.gurmukhi: Awie pieAw srxwgqI mwrIdw AMbrIk CufwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aai Paiaa Saranaagatee Maareedaa Anbareek Chhudaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then he surrendered before Ambaris and Ambaris saved the dying sage.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu jig ibrd sdwieAw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhalu Jagi Biradu Sadaaiaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord God came to be known in the world as benevolent to devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 rwjw jnk

Shabad OS B.translation: King Janak

lines.gurmukhi: Bgqu vfw rwjw jnku hY gurmuiK mwieAw ivic audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagatu Vadaa Raajaa Janaku Hai Guramoukhi Maaiaa Vichi Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: King Janak was a great saint who amidst maya remained indifferent to it.

lines.gurmukhi: dyv lok no cilAw gx gMDrb sBw suKvwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Dayv Lok No Chaliaa Gan Gandharaboo Sabhaa Soukhavaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Along with gans and gandharvs (calestial musicians) he went to the abode of the gods.

lines.gurmukhi: jmpuir gieAw pukwr suix ivllwvin jIA nrk invwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Jamapuri Gaiaa Poukaar Souni Vilalaavini Jeea Narak Nivaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From there, he, hearing the cries of inhabitants of hell, went to them.

lines.gurmukhi: Drmrwie no AwiKEnu sBnwN dI kir bMd KlwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharam Raai No Aakhiaonu Sabhanaa Dee Kari Band Khalaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He asked the god of death, Dharamrai, to relieve all their suffering.

lines.gurmukhi: kry bynqI Drmrwie hau syvk Twkuru AibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Karay Baynatee Dharamaraai Hau Sayvaku Tdaakuru Abinaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hearing this, the god of death told him he was a mere servant of the eternal Lord (and without His orders he could not liberate them).

lines.gurmukhi: gihxy DirAnu eyk nwau pwpw nwil krY inrjwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Gahinay Dhariaonu Iku Naau Paapaa Naali Karai Nirajaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Janak offered a part of his devotion and remembrance of the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pwsMig pwpu n pujnI gurmuiK nwau Aqul n qulwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Paasangi Paapu N Pujanee Guramoukhi Naau Atul N Tulaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the sins of hell were found not equal even to the counterweight of balance.

lines.gurmukhi: nrkhuM Cuty jIA jMq ktI glhuM islk jm PwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Narakahu Chhoutay Jeea Jant Katee Galahoun Silak Jam Dhaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact no balance can weigh the fruits of recitation and remembrance of the Lords name by the gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: mukiq jugiq nwvY dI dwsI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Moukati Jougati Naavai Dee Daasee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the creatures got liberated from hell and the noose of death was cut.  Liberation and the technique of attaining it are the servants of the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 hrI cMd qy qwrw rwxI

Shabad OS B.translation: Harischandar and queen Taramati

lines.gurmukhi: suKu rwjy hrI cMd Gir nwir su qwrw locn rwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Soukhu Raajay Haree Chand Ghari Naari Su Taaraa Lochan Raanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: King HariChand had a queen with beautiful eyes, Tara, who had made his home the abode of comforts.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil gwvdy rwqI jwie suxY gurbwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Mili Gaavaday Raatee Jaai Sounai Gurabaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: At night she would go to the place where in the form of holy congregation, would recite the holy hymns.

lines.gurmukhi: ipCY rwjw jwigAw ADI rwiq inKMif ivhwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Pichhai Raajaa Jaagiaa Adhee Raati Nikhandi Vihaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: After she had left, the King awoke in the middle of the night and realised she had gone.

lines.gurmukhi: rwxI idis n AwveI mn ivic vrq geI hYrwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Raanee Disi N Aavaee Man Vichi Varati Gaee Hairaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He could not find the Queen anywhere and his heart filled with astonishment

lines.gurmukhi: horqu rwqI auiT kY cilAw ipCY qrl juAwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Horatu Raatee Outdi Kai Chaliaa Pichhai Taral Juaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The following night he followed the young queen.

lines.gurmukhi: rwxI phuqI sMgqI rwjy KVI KVwau nIswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Raanee Pahoutee Sangatee Raajay Kharhee Kharhaau Neesaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The queen reached the holy congregation and the King lifted one of her sandals from there (so that he could prove the infidelity of the queen).

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq AwrwiDAw joVI juVI KVwau purwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Aaraadhiaa Jorhee Jurhee Kharhaau Puraanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When about to go, the queen concentrated upon the holy congregation and the one sandal became a pair.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy ifTw cilqu iehu eyh KVwv hY coj ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Ditdaa Chalitu Ihu Ayh Kharhaav Hai Doj Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The king upheld this feat and realized that there her matching sandal was a miracle.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivthu kurbwxI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vitahu Kurabaanee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 ibdr Ar durjoDn

Shabad OS B.translation: Vidur and Duryodhan

lines.gurmukhi: AwieAw suixAw ibdr dy bolY durjoDnu hoie ruKw
lines.transliteration_english: Aaiaa Souniaa Bidar Day Bolai Durajodhanu Hoi Roukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hearing that Lord Krishan was served and stayed over at humble Bidar's home, Duryodhan remarked sarcastically.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir Aswfy Cif kY goly dy Gir jwih ik suKw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Asaaday Chhadi Kai Golay Day Ghari Jaahi Ki Soukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving our grand palaces, how much happiness and comfort did you attain in the home of a servant?

lines.gurmukhi: BIKmu dRoxw krx qij sBw sIgwr vfy mwnuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Bheekhamu Dronaa Karan Taji Sabhaa Seegaar Vaday Maanoukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: You gave up even Bhikhaum, Dohna and Karan who are recognised as great men who are adorned in all courts.

lines.gurmukhi: JuMgI jwie vlwieEn sBnw dy jIA AMdir DuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Jhoungee Jaai Valaaiaonu Sabhanaa Day Jeea Andari Dhoukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: We have all been anguished to find that you have lived in a hut”.

lines.gurmukhi: his boly Bgvwn jI suixho rwjw hoie snmuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Hasi Bolai Bhagavaan Jee Souniho Raajaa Hoi Sanamoukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then smilingly, Lord Krishan asked the King to come forward and to listen carefully.

lines.gurmukhi: qyry Bwau n idseI myry nwhI Apdw duKw
lines.transliteration_english: Tayray Bhaau N Disaee Mayray Naahee Apadaa Doukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: I see no love and devotion in you (and hence I have not come to you).

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau ijvyhw ibdr dy horI dy iciq cwau n cuKw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Jivayhaa Bidar Day Horee Day Chiti Chaau N Choukhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No heart I see has even a fraction of the love that Bidar bears in his heart.

lines.gurmukhi: goibMd Bwau Bgiq dw BuKw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Gobind Bhaau Bhagati Daa Bhoukhaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord needs loving devotion and nothing else.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 dRopqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Draupadi

lines.gurmukhi: AMdir sBw duswsxY mQyvwl dRopqI AwNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Andari Sabhaa Dousaasanai Madayvaali Dropatee Aandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dragging Daropati by the hair, Dusasanai brought her into the assembly.

lines.gurmukhi: dUqw no PurmwieAw nMgI krhu pMcwlI bwNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Dootaa Nay Phuramaaiaa Nagee Karahu Panchaalee Baandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He commanded his men to strip the maidservant Dropati stark naked.

lines.gurmukhi: pMjy pwNfo vyKdy AauGit ruDI nwir ijnHwN dI
lines.transliteration_english: Panjay Paando Vaykhaday Aoughati Rudhee Naari Jinaa Dee.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the five Pandavs who she was the wife of, beheld this.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI mIit iDAwnu Dir hwhw kiRsn krY ibllwNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Meet Dhiaanu Dhari Haahaa Krisan Karai Bilalaandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crying, totally dejected and helpless, she closed her eyes. Single-mindedly she invoked Krishna for help.

lines.gurmukhi: kpV kotu auswirEnu Qky dUq n pwir vswNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaparh Kotu Ousaariaonu Dakay Doot N Paari Vasaandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The servants were taking off the clothes from her body but more layers of clothes formed a fort around her; the servants got tired but the layers of clothes were never ending.

lines.gurmukhi: hQ mroVin isr Duxin pCoqwin krin jwih jwNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Had Marorhani Siru Dhounani Pachhotaani Karani Jaahi Jaandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The servants were now writhing and frustrated on their abortive attempt and felt that they themselves were ashamed.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir AweI Twkur imly pYj rhI boly SrmwNdI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Aaee Tdaakur Milay Paij Rahee Bolay Saramaandee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On reaching home, Dropati was asked by Lord Krishna whether she was saved in the assembly.

lines.gurmukhi: nwQ AnwQwN bwix DurwNdI ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Naad Anaadaan Baani Dhuraandee ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: She shyly replied, “Since perennial times you are living up to your reputation of being father of the fatherless ones.”

lines.gurmukhi: 9 sudwmw Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Sudama

lines.gurmukhi: ibp sudwmw dwildI bwl sKweI imqRR sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bipu Sudaamaa Daalidee Baal Sakhaaee Mitr Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sudama, a poor brahman, was known to be a friend of Krishna from childhood.

lines.gurmukhi: lwgU hoeI bwmHxI imil jgdIs dildRR gvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Laagoo Hoee Baamhanee Mili Jagadees Dalidr Gavaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: His brahmin wife always pestered him as to why he did not go to Lord Krishna to alleviate his poverty.

lines.gurmukhi: cilAw gxdw gtIAwN ikau kir jweIAY kauxu imlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaliaa Ganadaa Gateeaan Kiu Kari Jaaeeai Kaounu Milaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He was perplexed and pondered over how he could get re-introduced to Krishna, who could help him meet the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: phuqw ngir duAwrkw isMG duAwir Kloqw jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pahoutaa Nagari Duaarakaa Singh Duaari Khalotaa Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He reached the town of Duaraka and stood before the main gate (of the palace of Krishna).

lines.gurmukhi: dUrhuM dyiK fMfauq kir Cif isMGwsxu hir jI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Doorahu Daykhi Dandaouti Kari Chhadi Singhaasanu Hari Jee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing him from a distance, Krishna, the Lord, bowed and leaving his throne came to Sudama.

lines.gurmukhi: pihly dy prdKxw pYrI pY ky lY gil lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pahilay Day Paradakhanaa Pairee Pai Kay Lai Gali Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: First he circumambulated around Sudama and then touching his feet he embraced him.

lines.gurmukhi: crxodku lY pYr Doie isMGwsxu auqy bYTwey
lines.transliteration_english: Charanodaku Lai Pair Dhoi Singhaasanu Outay Baitdaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Washing his feet he took that water and made Sudama sit on the throne.

lines.gurmukhi: puCy kuslu ipAwru kir gur syvw dI kQw suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhay Kousalu Piaaru Kari Gur Sayvaa Dee Kadaa Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then Krishna lovingly enquired about his welfare and talked about the time when they were together in the service of the guru (Sandipani).

lines.gurmukhi: lY kY qMdul cibEnu ivdw kry AgY phucwey
lines.transliteration_english: Lai Kay Tandul Chabiaonu Vidaa Karay Agai Pahouchaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Krishna asked for the rice sent by Sudama’s wife and after eating, came out to see off his friend Sudama.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ skuic pTwey ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Padaarad Sakouchi Patdaaay ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Though all the four boons (righteousness,wealth,fulfillment of desire and libereation) were given to Sudama by Krishna, Krishna's humbleness still made him feel totally helpless.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 jYdyau Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Jaidev

lines.gurmukhi: pRym Bgiq jYdyau kir gIq goivMd shj Duin gwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Bhagati Jaidayu Kari Geet Govind Sahaj Dhouni Gaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting immersed in the loving devotion, the devotee Jaidev would sing the songs of the Lord (Govind).

lines.gurmukhi: lIlHw cilq vKwxdw AMqrjwmI Twkur BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Leelaa Chalit Vakhaanadaa Antarajaamee Tdaakur Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would describe the glorious feats accomplished by God and was greatly loved by him.

lines.gurmukhi: AKr ieku n AwvVY pusqku bMniH sMiDAw kir AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Akharu Iku N Aavarhai Pousatak Bannhi Sandhiaa Kari Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (Jaidev) knew no would and hence binding his book would return home in the evening.

lines.gurmukhi: gux inDwn Gir Awie kY Bgq rUip iliK lyKu bxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Goun Nidhaanu Ghari Aai Kai Bhagat Roopi Likhi Laykhu Banaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: God, the repository of all virtues in the form of the devotee Himself wrote all the songs for him.

lines.gurmukhi: AKr pViH prqIiq kir hoie ivsmwdu n AMig smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Akhar Parhhi Parateeti Kari Hoi Visamaadu N Angi Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Jaidev would get elated seeing and reading those words.

lines.gurmukhi: vyKY jwie aujwiV ivic ibrKu ieku Awcrj suhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vaykhai Jaai Ujaarhi Vichi Birakhu Iku Aacharaju Suhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Jaidev saw a wonderful tree in the deep forest.

lines.gurmukhi: gIq goibMd sMpUrxo piq piq iliKAw AMqu n pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Geet Govind Sanpoorano Pati Pati Likhiaa Antu N Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Each and every leaf had the songs of the Lord Govind written on it. He could not understand this mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq hyiq prgwsu kir hoie dieAwlu imlY gil lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Hayti Paragaasu Kari Hoi Daiaalu Milai Gali Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to the love for the devotee, God embraced him in person.

lines.gurmukhi: sMq AnMq n Byd gxwvY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Sant Anat N Bhaydu Ganaavai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: God and saint have no veil in between.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 nwmdyv

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev

lines.gurmukhi: kMm ikqY ipau cilAw nwmdyau no AwiK isDwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kanm Kitay Piu Chaliaa Naamadayu No Aakhi Sidhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev's father was called to do some work so he called Naamdev.

lines.gurmukhi: Twkur dI syvw krIN duDu pIAwvxu kih smJwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur Dee Sayvaa Karee Dudhu Peeaavanu Kahi Samajhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He told Namdev to serve Thakur, the Lord, with milk.

lines.gurmukhi: nwmdyau iesnwnu kir kpl gwie duih kY lY AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Naamadayu Isanaanu Kari Kapal Gaai Duhi Kai Lay Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: After taking bath Namdev brought the milk of black-teat cow.

lines.gurmukhi: Twkur no nHwvwilkY crxodku lY iqlku cVHwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur No Nhaavaali Kai Charanodaku Lai Tilaku Charhhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having bathed the Thakur, he put the water used to wash the Thakur, on his own head.

lines.gurmukhi: hiQ joiV ibnqI krY dUDu pIAhu jI goibMd rwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hadi Jorhi Binatee Karai Dudhu Peeahu Jee Gobind Raaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now with folded hands he requested the Lord to have milk.

lines.gurmukhi: inhcau kir AwrwiDAw hoie dieAwlu drsu idKlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nihachau Kari Aaraadhiaa Hoi Daiaalu Darasu Dikhalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming steadfast in his thoughts when he prayed, the Lord appeared before him in person.

lines.gurmukhi: BrI ktorI nwmdyiv lY Twkur no dUD pIAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bharee Katoree Naamadayvi Lai Tdaakur No Dudhu Peeaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev made Lord drink the full bowl of milk.

lines.gurmukhi: gwie mueI jIvwilEnu nwmdyau dw Cpr CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gaai Muee Jeevaaliaonu Naamadayv Daa Chhaparu Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On another occasion God brought a dead cow to life and also thatched the hut of Namdev.

lines.gurmukhi: Pyir dyhurw riKEnu cwir vrn lY pYrI pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhayri Dayhuraa Rakhiaonu Chaari Varan Lai Pairee Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On yet another occasion, God rotated the temple (after Naamdev was not allowed entrance) and made all the four castes (varnas) bow at the feet of Namdev.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgq jnw dw kry krwieAw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagat Janaa Daa Karay Karaaiaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord accomplishes whatever is done and desired by saints.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 nwmdyv Ar qiRlocn

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev and Trilochan

lines.gurmukhi: drsnu vyKx nwmdyv Blky auiT qiRlocn AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Darasanu Daykhan Naamadayv Bhalakay Outdi Trilochanu Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Trilochan awoke early daily just to have sight of Namdev,

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq krin imil duie jxy nwmdyau hir cilqu suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Karani Mili Dui Janay Naamadayu Hari Chalitu Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Together they would concentrate on the Lord and Namdev would tell him the grand stories of God.

lines.gurmukhi: myrI BI kir bynqI drsnu dyKwN jy iqsu BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Mayree Bhee Kari Baynatee Darasanu Daykhaan Jay Tisu Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: (Trilochan asked Namdev) “kindly pray for me so that if the Lord accepts, I may also have a glimpse of His blessed vision.”

lines.gurmukhi: Twkur jI no puiCEsu drsnu ikvY qiRlocnu pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur Jee No Pouchhiaosu Darasanu Kivai Trilochanu Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Namdev asked Thakur, the Lord, as to how Trilochan could have sight of the Lord ?

lines.gurmukhi: hiskY Twkur boilAw nwmdyau no kih smJwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hasi Kai Tdaakur Boliaa Naamadayu No Kahi Samajhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord God smiled and explained to Naamdev;

lines.gurmukhi: hiQ n AwvY Bytu so quis qiRlocn mY muih lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hadi N Aavai Bhaytu So Tousi Trilochan Mai Muhi Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: “No offerings are needed by me.  Out of my delight only, I would make Trilochan to have sight of me. "

lines.gurmukhi: hau ADInu hwN Bgq dy phuMic n hMGwN BgqI dwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Adheenu Haan Bhagat Day Pahounchi N Hanghaan Bhagatee Daavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am under the total control of the devotees and their loving claims I can never reject; rather I myself also cannot understand them.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie ivcolw Awix imlwvY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Vicholaa Aani Milaavai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Their loving devotion, in fact, becomes mediator and makes them meet me.”

lines.gurmukhi: 13 DMnw Aqy bRwhmn

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanna and brahmin

lines.gurmukhi: bwmHx pUjY dyvqy DMnw gaU crwvx AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Baamhanu Poojai Dayvatay Dhannaa Gaoo Charaavani Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A brahman would worship gods (in the form of stone idols) where Dhanna used to graze his cow.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnY ifTw cilqu eyhu puCY bwmHxu AwiK suxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannai Ditdaa Chalitu Ayhu Poochhai Baamhanu Aakhi Sounaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: On seeing his worship, Dhanna asked the brahman what he was doing.

lines.gurmukhi: Twkur dI syvw krY jo ieCY soeI Plu pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur Dee Sayvaa Karay Jo Ichhai Soee Phalu Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: “Service to the Thakur (God) gives the desired fruit,” replied the brahman.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnw krdw jodVI mY iB dyh iek jy quDu BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannaa Karadaa Jodarhee Mai Bhi Dayh Ik Jay Tudhu Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanna requested, “O brahman, if you agree kindly give one to me.”

lines.gurmukhi: pQru iek lpyit kir dy DMnY no gYl CufwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Padaru Iku Lapayti Kari Day Dhannai No Gail Chhudaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The brahman rolled a stone, gave it to Dhanna and thus got rid of him.

lines.gurmukhi: Twkur no nHwvwilkY Cwih rotI lY Bogu cVHwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaakur No Nhaavaali Kai Chhaahi Rotee Lai Bhogu Charhhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanna bathed the Thakur and offered him bread and buttermilk.

lines.gurmukhi: hiQ joiV imnqwN krY pYrIN pY pY bhuq mnwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hadi Jorhi Minati Karai Pairee Pai Pai Bahoutu Manaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With folded hands and falling at the feet of the stone he begged for his service to be accepted.

lines.gurmukhi: hauN BI muhu n juTwlswN qU ruTw mY ikhu n suKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hau Bhee Muhu N Joutdaalasaan Too Routdaa Mai Kihu N Soukhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhanna said, “I will also not eat because how can I be happy if you are annoyed.”

lines.gurmukhi: gosweI prqiK hoie rotI Kwie Cwih muih lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gosaaee Paratakhi Hoi Rotee Khaahi Chhaahi Muhi Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: (Seeing his true and loving devotion) God was forced to appear and eat his bread and buttermilk.

lines.gurmukhi: Bolw Bwau goibMdu imlwvY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Bholaa Bhaau Gobindu Milaavai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact, innocence like that of Dhanna makes the sight of the Lord available.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 byxI Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Beni

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK byxI Bgiq kir jwie iekwNq bhY ilv lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Baynee Bhagati Kari Jaai Ikaantu Bahai Liv Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Saint Beni, a gurmukh, used to sit in solitude and would enter a meditative trance.

lines.gurmukhi: krm krY AiDAwqmI horsu iksY n AlKu lKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Karai Adhiaatamee Horasu Kisai N Alakhu Lakhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would perform spiritual activities and in humbleness would never tell anyone.

lines.gurmukhi: Gir AwieAw jw puCIAY rwju duAwir gieAw AwlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Aaiaa Jaa Pouchheeai Raaj Duaari Gaiaa Aalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching back home when asked, he would tell people that he had gone to the door of his king (the Supreme Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: Gir sB vQU mMgIAin vl Clu kir kY Jqu lMGwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghari Sabh Vadoo Mangeeani Valu Chhalu Kari Kai Jhat Laghaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When his wife asked for some household material he would avoid her and thus spend his time performing spiritual activities.

lines.gurmukhi: vfw swNgu vrqdw Eh iek min prmysru iDAwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vadaa Saangu Varatadaa Aoh Ik Mani Paramaysaru Dhiaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One day while concentrating on the Lord with single-minded devotion, a strange miracle happened.

lines.gurmukhi: pYj svwrY Bgq dI rwjw huie kY Gir cil AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Paij Savaarai Bhagat Dee Raajaa Hoi Kai Ghari Chali Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To keep the glory of the devotee, God Himself in the form of King went to his house.

lines.gurmukhi: dyie idlwsw quiskY AxgxqI KrcI phuMcwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dayi Dilaasaa Tousi Kai Anaganatee Kharachee Pahounchaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In great joy, He consoled everyone and made available profuse money for expenditure.

lines.gurmukhi: EQhuM AwieAw Bgq pwis hoie dieAwlu hyqu aupjwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aodahu Aaiaa Bhagati Paasi Hoi Daiaalu Haytu Oupajaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: From there He came to His devotee Beni and compassionately loved him.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgq jnwN jYkwru krwvY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagat Janaan Jaikaaru Karaavai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way He arranges applause for His devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 kbIr Aqy rwmwnMd

Shabad OS B.translation: Kabir and Ramanand

lines.gurmukhi: hoie ibrkqu bnwrsI rihMdw rwmwnMdu gusweIN
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Birakatu Banaarasee Rahindaa Raamaanadu Gousaaeen.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being detached from the world, Brahmin Ramanand lived in Varanasi (Kasi).

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRqu vyly auiT kY jwNdw gMgw nHwvx qweIN
lines.transliteration_english: Anmritu Vaylay Outdi Kai Jaandaa Gangaa Nhaavan Taaeen.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would rise early in the morning and go to the Ganges to bathe.

lines.gurmukhi: Ago hI dy jwie kY lMmw ipAw kbIr iqQweIN
lines.transliteration_english: Ago Hee Day Jaai Kai Lamaa Piaa Kabeer Tidaaeen.

Shabad OS B.translation: Once even before Ramanand, Kabir went there and lay in the way.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI tuMb auTwilAw bolhu rwm isK smJweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Tounbi Outdaaliaa Bolahu Raam Sikh Samajhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching with his feet Ramanand awakened Kabir and told him to speak ‘Ram’, the true spiritual teaching.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau lohw pwrsu Cuhy cMdn vwsu inMmu mhkweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Lohaa Paarasu Chhuhay Chandan Vaasu Nimu Mahakaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the iron touched by philosopher’s stone becomes gold and the margosa tree (Azadirachta indica) is made fragrant by sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: psU pryqhu dyv kir pUry siqgur dI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Kari Pooray Satigur Dee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wondrous Guru turns even animals and ghosts into angels.

lines.gurmukhi: Acrj no Acrju imlY ivsmwdY ivsmwdu imlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Acharaj No Acharaju Milai Visamaadai Visamaadu Milaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting the wonderous Guru the disciple wonderfully merges into the great wonderous Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Jrxw Jrdw inJrhuM gurmuiK bwxI AGV GVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jharanaa Jharadaa Nijharahu Guramoukhi Baanee Agharh Gharhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then from the Self springs a fountain and the words of the gurmukhs shape a beautiful form

lines.gurmukhi: rwm kbIrY Bydu n BweI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Kabeerai Bhaydu N Bhaaee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Now Ram and Kabir became identical.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 sYn nweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Sain, The barber

lines.gurmukhi: suix prqwpu kbIr dw dUjw isK hoAw sYxu nweI
lines.transliteration_english: Souni Parataapu Kabeer Daa Doojaa Sikhu Hoaa Sainu Naaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hearing of glory of Kabir, Sain also turned to be a disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: pRyim Bgiq rwqI krY BlkY rwj duAwrY jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Bhagati Raatee Karai Bhalakai Raaj Duaarai Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the night he would immerse in loving devotion and in the morning he would serve at the door of the king.

lines.gurmukhi: Awey sMq prwhuxy kIrqnu hoAw rYix sbweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aaay Sant Paraahounay Keeratanu Hoaa Raini Sabaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On one night some sadhus came to him and the whole night was spent in singing the Lord's praises

lines.gurmukhi: Cif n skY sMq jn rwj duAwir n syv kmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhadi N Sakai Sant Jan Raaj Duaari N Sayv Kamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sain could not leave company of the saints and consequently did not perform the king’s service the following morning.

lines.gurmukhi: sYx rUip hir jwie kY AwieAw rwxY no rIJweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sain Roopi Hari Jaai Kai Aaiaa Raanai No Reejhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: God himself took the form of Sain. He served the king in such a way that the king was overjoyed.

lines.gurmukhi: swD jnwN no ivdw kir rwj duAwir gieAw srmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Janaan No Vidaa Kari Raaj Duaari Gaiaa Saramaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bidding fairwell to the saints, Sain hesitantly arrived at the palace of the king.

lines.gurmukhi: rwxY dUrhuM sidkY glhuM kvwie KoliH pYnHweI
lines.transliteration_english: Raanai Doorahoun Sadi Kai Galahoun Kavaai Kholi Painhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The king From a distance the king called him nearby. He took off his own robes and offered them to Bhagat Sain.

lines.gurmukhi: vis kIqw hauN quDu Aju bolY rwj suxY lukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vasi Keetaa Haoun Tudhu Aju Bolai Raajaa Sounai Loukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: ‘You have overpowered me’, said the king and his words were heard by one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: prgtu krY Bgiq vifAweI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Paragatu Karai Bhagati Vadiaaee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: God himself manifests the grandeur of the devotee.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 rivdws Bgq

Shabad OS B.translation: Ravidas

lines.gurmukhi: Bgqu Bgqu jig vijAw chuM ckwN dy ivic cimrytw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagatu Bhagatu Jagi Vajiaa Chahu Chakaan Day Vichi Chamiraytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tanner (Ravidas) became renowned as bhagat (saint) in all the four directions.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxHw gMFY rwh ivic kulw Drm Foie For smytw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanhaa Ganddhai Raah Vichi Kulaa Dharam Ddhoi Ddhor Samaytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In accordance with his family tradition he would cobble the shoes and carry away the dead animals.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau kir mYlY cIQVY hIrw lwl Amolu plytw
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Kari Mailay Cheedarhay Heeraa Laalu Amolu Palaytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This was his outward routine but in reality he was a gem wrapped in rags.

lines.gurmukhi: chuM vrnw aupdysdw igAwn iDAwnu kir Bgiq shytw
lines.transliteration_english: Chahu Varanaa Oupadaysadaa Giaan Dhiaanu Kari Bhagati Sahaytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He would preach all the four varnas (castes).  His preaching made them rapt in the meditative devotion for the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: nHwvix AwieAw sMgu imil bwnwrs kir gMgw Qytw
lines.transliteration_english: Nhaavani Aaiaa Sangu Mili Baanaaras Kari Gangaa Daytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Once, a group of people went to Kasi (Varanasi) to have their sacred dip in the Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: kiF ksIrw sauipAw rivdwsY gMgw dI Bytw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaddhi Kaseeraa Saoupiaa Ravidaasai Gangaa Dee Bhaytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ravidas gave one dhela (half a pice) to one member and asked him to offer it to the Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: lgw purbu ABIc dw ifTw cilqu Acrj Amytw
lines.transliteration_english: Lagaa Purabu Abheech Daa Ditdaa Chalitu Acharaju Amaytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A great festival of Abhijit naksatr (star) was on there where the public saw this wonderful episode.

lines.gurmukhi: lieAw ksIrw hQu kiF sUqu ieku ijau qwxw pytw
lines.transliteration_english: Laiaa Kaseeraa Hadu Kaddhi Sootu Iku Jiu Taanaa Paytaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ganges, herself taking out her hand accepted that paltry amount, dhela, and proved that Ravidas was one with Ganges as warp and weft.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgq jnwN hir mwN ipau bytw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagat Janaan Hari Maan Piu Baytaa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: For bhagats (saints,) God is their mother, father and son all in one.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 Aih`ilAw Aqy goqm

Shabad OS B.translation: Ahalya and Gautam

lines.gurmukhi: goqm nwir AihilAw iqsno dyiK ieMdRR loBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gotam Naari Ahiliaa Tisano Daykhi Indr Lobhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ahalya was wife of Gautam.  But when she set eyes Indhar, the king of gods, lust overpowered her.

lines.gurmukhi: pr Gir jwie srwpu lY hoie shs Bg pCoqwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Par Ghari Jaai Saraapu Lai Hoi Sahas Bhag Pachhotaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He entered their house, got curse of being with thousands of pudendums and repented.

lines.gurmukhi: suM\\\\w hoAw ieMdRR loku luikAw srvr min srmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sounaa Hoaa Indr Loku Loukiaa Saravari Mani Saramaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Indralok (abode of Indr) became desolate and getting ashamed of himself he hid in a pond.

lines.gurmukhi: shs Bghu loiex shs lYNdoeI ieMd purI isDwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Bhagahu Loin Sahas Laindoee Indr Puree Sidhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On revocation of the curse when all those holes became eyes, only then he returned to his habitat.

lines.gurmukhi: sqI sqhu til islw hoie ndI iknwrY bwJu prwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Satee Satahu Tali Silaa Hoi Nadee Kinaarai Baajhu Paraanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ahalya who could not remain steadfast in her chastity became stone and remained lying on the river bank

lines.gurmukhi: rGupiq crx CuhMidAwN clI surg puir bxy ibbwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Raghoupati Charani Chhuhandiaa Chalee Surag Puri Banay Bibaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching the (holy) feet of Ram she was lifted to the heavens.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgq vCl BilAweIAhuM piqq auDwrxu pwp kmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhalu Bhaliaaeeahu Patit Udhaaranu Paap Kamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of His benevolence He is mother-like to the devotees and being forgiver of the sinners He is called redeemer of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: gux no gux sB ko krY Aaugux kIqy gux iqsu jwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Goun No Goun Sabh Ko Karai Aougoun Keetay Goun Tisu Jaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Doing good is returned by good gestures always, but he who does good to the evil is known as virtuous.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq ikAw AwiK vKwxw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Kiaa Aakhi Vakhaanaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: How can I explain the greatness of that unmanifest (Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 19 bwlmIk btvwVw

Shabad OS B.translation: Valmiki

lines.gurmukhi: vwtY mwxs mwrdw bYTw bwlmIk btvwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaatai Maanas Maaradaa Baitdaa Baalameek Vatavaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Valmeel was a highwayman Valmiki who would rob and kill travellers passing by.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrw siqguru ByitAw mn ivic hoAw iKMjoqwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooraa Satiguru Bhaytiaa Man Vichi Hoaa Khijo Taarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then he began serving the true Guru, Now his mind became diffident about his work.

lines.gurmukhi: mwrn no locY Gxw kiF n hMG hQu auGwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Maaran No Lochai Ghanaa Kaddhi N Hanghai Hadu Oughaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His mind still urged to kill people but his hands would not obey.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur mnUAw rwiKAw hoie n AwvY auCohwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Manooaa Raakhiaa Hoi N Aavai Ouchhayhaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru made his mind tranquil and all the volition of mind came to an end.

lines.gurmukhi: Aauguxu sB prgwisAnu rojgwru hY eyhu AswVw
lines.transliteration_english: Aougounu Sabh Paragaasianu Rojagaaru Hai Ayhu Asaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He unfolded all the evils of mind before the Guru and said, ‘O Lord, this is a profession for me.’

lines.gurmukhi: Gir ivic puCx GilAw AMqkwl hY koie AswVw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Vichi Pouchhan Ghaliaa Antikaal Hai Koi Asaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru asked him to enquire at home as to which family members would be co-partner him of his evil deeds at death.

lines.gurmukhi: koVmVw cauKMnIAY koie n bylI krdy JwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Korhamarhaa Chaoukhanneeai Koi N Baylee Karaday Jhaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But although his family were always ready to be sacrifice unto him, none of them were ready to accept responsibility.

lines.gurmukhi: scu diRVHHwie auDwirAnu tip inkQw aupr vwVw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Drirhaai Udhaarianu Tapi Nikadaa Oupar Vaarhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On returning, the Guru placed the sermon of truth within his heart and made him a liberated one. With a single leap he was released from the net of worldliness.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK lMGy pwp phwVw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Laghay Paap Pahaarhaa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming gurmukh, one becomes capable of jumping across mountains of sins.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 Ajwml

Shabad OS B.translation: Ajamil

lines.gurmukhi: piqq Ajwmlu pwp kir jwie klwvqxI dy rihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Patitu Ajaamal Paapu Kari Jaai Kalaavatanee Day Rahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ajamil, the fallen sinner lived with a prostitute.

lines.gurmukhi: guru qy bymuKu hoie kY pwp kmwvY durmiq dihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Tay Baymoukhu Hoi Kai Paap Kamaavai Duramati Dahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He became an apostate. He was entangled in the cobweb of evil deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrQw jnmu gvwieAnu Bvjl AMdir iPrdw vihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Biradaa Janamu Gavaaiaa Bhavajal Andari Dhiradaa Vahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His life was wasted in futile deeds and was tossed and thrown within the terrifying worldly ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA puq jwey vysuAw pwpwN dy Pl ieCy lihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Pout Jaaay Vaysuaa Paapaa Day Phal Ichhay Lahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: While with the prostitute, he became the father of six sons.  As a result of her bad deeds they all became dangerous robbers.

lines.gurmukhi: puqu aupMnwN sqvwN nwau Drx no iciq aumihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Poutu Oupannaan Satavaan Naau Dharan No Chiti Oumahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A seventh son was born and he began to consider a name for the child.

lines.gurmukhi: gurU duAwrY jwie kY gurmuiK nwau nrwiexu kihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Duaarai Jaai Kai Guramoukhi Naau Naraainu Kahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He visited the Guru who named his son Narayan (a name for God).

lines.gurmukhi: AMqkwl jmdUq vyiK puq nrwiexu bolY CihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Antakaal Jamadoot Vaykhi Pout Naraainu Bolai Chhahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: At the end of his life, seeing the messengers of death Ajamil cried for Narayan.

lines.gurmukhi: jmgx mwry hir jnwN gieAw surg jmufMfu n sihAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jamagan Maaray Hari Janaan Gaiaa Surag Jamu Dandu N Sahiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The name of God made the death messengers take to their heels. Ajamil went to heaven and did not suffer the beatings from the club of the messengers of death.

lines.gurmukhi: nwie ley duKu fyrw FihAw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Naai Laay Doukhu Dayraa Ddhahiaa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Utterance of Name of the Lord dispels all sorrow.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 ginkw

Shabad OS B.translation: The Prostitute

lines.gurmukhi: ginkw pwpix hoie kY pwpwN dw gil hwru proqw
lines.transliteration_english: Ganikaa Paapani Hoi Kai Paapaan Daa Gali Haaru Parotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gankaa was a sinful prostitute who wore the necklace of misdeeds around her neck.

lines.gurmukhi: mhwN purKu Awcwxck ginkw vwVy Awie Kloqw
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaan Purakh Aachaanachak Ganikaa Vaarh Aai Khalotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Once a great man was passing by who halted in her courtyard.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq dyiK dieAwl hoie hQhuM aus no idqonu qoqw
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Daykhi Daiaalu Hoi Hadahu Ous No Ditonu Totaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing her bad plight he became compassionate and offered her a special parrot.

lines.gurmukhi: rwm nwmu aupdysu kir Kyil gieAw dy vxju sEqw
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Naamu Oupadaysu Kari Khayli Gaiaa Day Vanaju Saaotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He told her to teach the parrot to repeat the name of Ram. Having made her understand this fruitful trade he then went away.

lines.gurmukhi: ilv lwgI iqsu qoiqAhuN inq pVHwey krY Asoqw
lines.transliteration_english: Liv Lagee Tisu Totiahu Nit Parhhaaay Karai Asotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Each and every day, with full concentration, she would teach the parrot to say Ram.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu rwm nwmu durmiq pwp klyvru Doqw
lines.transliteration_english: Patitu Udhaaranu Raam Naamu Duramati Paap Kalayvaru Dhotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The name of Lord is the liberator of the fallen ones. It washed away her evil wisdom and deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqkwlu jm jwlu qoiV nrkY ivic n KwDusu goqw
lines.transliteration_english: Antakaali Jam Jaalu Torhi Narakai Vichi N Khaadhu Su Gotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: At the time of death, it cut away the noose of Yama - the messenger of death she did not have to drown in the ocean of hell.

lines.gurmukhi: geI bYkuMiT ibbwix cViH nwau nrwiexu Coiq ACoqw
lines.transliteration_english: Gaee Baikountdi Bibaani Charhhi Naaoun Rasaainu Chhoti Achhotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to the elixir of name (of the Lord) she became totally devoid of sins and was lifted to the heavens.

lines.gurmukhi: Qwau inQwvy mwxu mxoqw ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Daaoun Nidaavayn Maanu Manotaa ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: The name (of the Lord) is the last refuge of the shelterless ones.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 pUqnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Putana

lines.gurmukhi: AweI pwpix pUqnw duhI QxI ivhu lwie vhylI
lines.transliteration_english: Aaee Paapani Pootanaa Duhee Danee Vihu Laai Vahaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ill-reputed Putana applied poison on both of her teats.

lines.gurmukhi: Awie bYTI prvwr ivic nyhuM lwie nvhwix nvylI
lines.transliteration_english: Aai Baitdee Paravaar Vichi Nayhoun Laai Navahaani Navaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: She came to the family (of Nand) and started to express her newfound love for the family.

lines.gurmukhi: kuCiV ley goivMd rwie kir cytk cqurMg mhylI
lines.transliteration_english: Kouchharhi Laay Govind Raai Kari Chaytaku Chaturang Mahaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through her clever deception, she lifted Krishna in her lap.

lines.gurmukhi: mohxu mMmy pwieEnu bwhir AweI grb ghylI
lines.transliteration_english: Mohanu Manmay Paaiaonu Baahari Aaee Garab Gahaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With great pride she pressed her breast teat in the mouth of Krishna and came out.

lines.gurmukhi: dyh vDwie aucwieAnu iqh cirAwir nwir AiTKylI
lines.transliteration_english: Dayh Vadhaai Ouchaaianu Tih Chariaari Naari Atdikhaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now she expanded her body to a great extent.

lines.gurmukhi: iqhuM loAwN dw Bwru dy cMbiVAw gil hoie duhylI
lines.transliteration_english: Tihoun Loaan Daa Bhaaru Day Chanbarhiaa Gali Hoi Duhaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Krishna also becoming the full weight of the three worlds hung from and stuck to her neck.

lines.gurmukhi: Kwie pCwV phwV vwNig jwie peI EjwiV DkylI
lines.transliteration_english: Khaai Pachhaarh Pahaarh Vaangi Jaai Paee Ujaarhi Dhakaylee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting unconscious, and like a mountain she fell down into the forest.

lines.gurmukhi: kIqI mwaU quil shylI ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Keetee Maaoo Tuli Sahaylee ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: Krishna liberated her at last and gave her status of equal to his mother’s friend.

lines.gurmukhi: 23 b`Dk dw pRsMg

Shabad OS B.translation: Demise of krsna at the hands of a hunter

lines.gurmukhi: jwie suqw prBws ivic gofy auqy pYr pswry
lines.transliteration_english: Jaai Soutaa Parabhaas Vichi Goday Outay Pair Pasaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: At the sacred place of Prabhas, Krishna slept cross legged with his foot on his knee.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kml ivic pdmu hY iJliml JlkY vwNgI qwry
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Vichi Padamu Hai Jhilamil Jhalakay Vaangee Taaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The lotus sign in his foot was illuminating like a star.

lines.gurmukhi: biDku AwieAw Bwldw imrgY jwix bwxu lY mwry
lines.transliteration_english: Badhaku Aaiaa Bhaaladaa Miragai Jaani Baanu Lai Maaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: A hunter came and considering it an eye of a deer, shot the arrow.

lines.gurmukhi: drsn ifTosu jwie kY krx plwv kry pUkwry
lines.transliteration_english: Darasan Ditdosu Jaai Kai Karan Palaav Karay Poukaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: As he approached, he realised it was Krishna. He became full of sorrow and begged forgiveness.

lines.gurmukhi: gil ivic lIqw kiRSn jI Avguxu kIqw hir nw icqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Gali Vichi Leetaa Krisan Jee Avagounu Keetaa Hari N Chitaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Krishna ignored his wrong act and embraced him.

lines.gurmukhi: kir ikrpw sMqoiKAw piqq auDwrxu ibrdu bIcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Kirapaa Santokhiaa Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Beechaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gracefully Krishna asked him to be full of perseverance and gave sactuary to the wrongdoer.

lines.gurmukhi: Bly Bly kir mMnIAin buirAwN dy hir kwj svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalay Bhalay Kari Manneeani Buriaan Day Hari Kaaj Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The good is said good by everyone but the works of the evil doers are set right by the Lord only.

lines.gurmukhi: pwp kryNdy piqq auDwry ]23]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Paap Karaynday Patit Udhaaray ?23?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: He has liberated many fallen sinners.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgurU pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

lines.transliteration_english: Dasam Sadaan Kay Samaani Kaoun Bhaoun Kahaao , Gurmukhi Paavai Su Tau Anat N Paavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: What other place of mystic abode can I say than the tenth concealed opening of a human being? Only the Guru conscious person can reach it by the grace of True Guru by meditating on His name.

lines.gurmukhi: aunmnI joiq ptMqr dIjY kaun joiq dieAw kY idKwvY jwhI qwhI bin AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Ounamanee Joti Patantar Deejai Kaoun Joti , Daiaa Kai Dikhaavai Jaahee Taahee Bani Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: What light can be equated with the radiance one receives at the time of spiritual enlightenment?

lines.transliteration_english: Anahad Naad Samasari Naad Baad Kaaona , Sree Gur Sounaavay Jaahi Soee Liv Laavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: What melodious musical sound can be equal to the melodious unstruck musical sound of divine word?

lines.gurmukhi: inJr Apwr Dwr quil n AMmiRq rs AipE pIAwvY jwih qwhI mY smwveI ]2]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Tuli N Anmrit Rasa , Apiao Peeaavai Jaahi Taahee Mai Samaavaee ?2?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: There is no other elixir capable of making one immortal than the one that flows perpetually in the concealed opening (Dasam Duar) of a human being. And one who is blessed by the True Guru (Satguru) to receive this elixir of immortality obtains it by His g
